Label: chromatographic separation process
Definition: A separation of the components of a sample based on their relative affinity between two non-miscible material entities.

Label: affinity chromatographic separation process
Definition: A separation of the components of a sample based on their ability to interact specifically with a molecule or a part of it

Label: chemically triggered transformation process
Definition: Transformation of a part or all the sample components by adding a chemical.

Label: gas chromatography separation process
Definition: A separation of the components of a sample using gas or vapor as a vector.

Label: thermomicro chromatographic separation process
Definition: A gas chromatography experiment using a sample mixed with a water-wet matrix that is slowly heated in a container. The water vapor caries sample components that reacted or not with the water or the media and adsorb on a TLC-plate that is placed next to the outlet of the container.

Label: thermofractographic separation process
Definition: A gas chromatography experiment using a sample in an open ended tube that is fed with nitrogen on one side and that is slowly heated. The gas caries sample components  and adsorb on a TLC-plate that is placed above the outlet of the container.

Label: isolation process
Definition: A separation of a single molecular entity from a sample.

Label: identification process
Definition: The identification of a single molecular entity by the derivation of some of its physicochemical characteristics.

Label: NMR spectral measurement process
Definition: The measurement of the Nuclear Magnetic Resonance spectrum of a sample.

Label: hydrogen-1 NMR spectral measurement process
Definition: The measurement of the hydrogen-1 nuclei Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR) spectrum of a sample.

Label: carbon-13 NMR spectral measurement process
Definition: The measurement of the carbon-13 nuclei Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR) spectrum of a sample.

Label: mass spectrometry measurement process
Definition: The measurement of the mass spectrum of a sample.

Label: fragmentation mass spectrometry measurement process
Definition: The measurement of the mass spectrum of fragments of a given sample or other fragments. The fragments are usually formed in a ionization chamber in the mass spectrometer.

Label: infrared spectrum measurement process
Definition: The measurement of the infrared absorption spectrum of a given sample.

Label: ultraviolet spectrum measurement process
Definition: The measurement of the ultraviolet absorption spectrum of a given sample.

Label: gas chromatography coupled to mass spectrometry separation process
Definition: A separation of the components of a sample using gas or vapor as a vector followed by detection in a mass spectrometer.

Label: liquid chromatographic separation process
Definition: A separation of the components of a sample based on their relative affinity between two non-miscible material entities one (and only one) of them being a liquid.
